```{r}
Cancer [(Cancer$avganncount > 20000),]
Cancer2 = Cancer [-c (1000,2374),]
Cancer2
Cancer2 [(Cancer2$avganncount > 20000),]



```


```{r}
summary (Cancer2)
```


```{r}
Cancer [(Cancer$medianage >100), c (10, 11, 12, 13)]
```




```{r}
Cancer2 <-Cancer2 [!(Cancer2$medianage > 100),]
Cancer2
```




```{r}
Cancer[Cancer$avganncount < 1963 & Cancer$avganncount > 1962,]
Cancer2 <-Cancer2 [!(Cancer2$avganncount > 1962 & Cancer2$avganncount < 1963),]
Cancer2 
```



```{r}
Cancer_m=  na.omit (Cancer2 [,-c( 9, 13, 17,24)])

Cancer_m
```





```{r}
M1 = lm (target_deathrate ~., data= Cancer_m)
summary (M1)
```

```{r}
plot (M1)
```










```{r}
Rs = rstudent(M1)
Rsc = rstudent(M1)
Rst =rstandard(M1)
plot (M1$fitted.values, Rs)
```



```{r}
ks.test (Rst, 'pnorm')
ks.test (Rsc, 'pt', nrow (Cancer_m)-ncol(Cancer_m))

```
Noise is not Gaussian, we cannot use the Fisher criterion



```{r}
StepAIC_M = stepAIC (M1, direction = 'both')

```

```{r}
M3 = lm (target_deathrate ~ avganncount + avgdeathsperyear + incidencerate + 
    medincome + povertypercent + medianagemale + percentmarried + 
    pctnohs18_24 + pcths18_24 + pcths25_over + pctbachdeg25_over + 
    pctemployed16_over + pctprivatecoverage + pctempprivcoverage + 
    pctwhite + pctasian + pctotherrace + pctmarriedhouseholds + 
    birthrate, data = Cancer_m)
summary (M3)
```





```{r}
plot (M3)
```






```{r}
StepF_M = stepAIC (M1,test = 'F',  direction = 'both')


```

```{r}
MR2 = leaps (Cancer_m [,-3], Cancer_m [,3], nbest=1, method = 'adjr2')
MR2
```
